title: Can Riot Design a REAL game mode instead of adding onto what we already have?
body:
**To be bold, it's time for a new map / play style.**

From Showdown to URF to Hexakill to Ascension and to the LotPK, these modes were always added onto the maps we already have, which can be incredibly boring (well, not URF) plus they also showed Riot's lack of dedication for further in-depth development. Hexakill, especially, shows no efforts were put in whatsoever. 

Please design a mode / map where players can actually have FUN. People want a 10v1 warcraft style boss co-op, people want a Hide and Seek mode, there are tons of ideas out there yet Riot has failed to acknowledge and manifest them into reality. This is rather disappointing and discouraging.

replies.body: Considering the state of dominion, I'm not surprised we aren't seeing major investments into fresh modes.
And TT, though that may be a little better off than dominion.
TT at least has a decent-sized playerbase for it.
To be fair, neglect of the gamemode, as well as allowing bots to run rampant on Dominion for months, really didn't help the game mode develop a pre-30 playerbase, which is important.

> [{quoted}](name=BLU Medic,realm=NA,application-id=LFfTlAky,discussion-id=GrnyUl4A,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2014-12-27T10:28:46.827+0000)
>
> To be fair, neglect of the gamemode, as well as allowing bots to run rampant on Dominion for months, really didn't help the game mode develop a pre-30 playerbase, which is important.

It depends on how you define neglect - I saw updates quite a bit when I was actively playing dom.  However, it didn't take long for the botting to take over, so I would consider that neglect for sure.

From what I've experienced of the new player experience pre-30, it's been horrid in general with all the modes plagued by afk autoleveling bots.

It's not the same sort of thing that SR/TT/HA all get. There was a bug with Azir that lets you get off your platform extra quickly and that took a while to fix.

Bots got pretty bad, but Dominion and Twisted Treeline always had it worse because of the smaller playerbases.
That being said, the map team is looking at maybe adding a new map down the road. Just not yet.

I think you are asking them to devote resources on new map/s which would be better spent on developing gameplay.  Put that money into making something that works even if its on an old map. Something like a teamfight mode would work just fine on howling=) 

Regardless I support the sentiments fully!
